com.deloitte.capi.transformers

Class TwitterConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mule.AbstractAnnotatedObject
      • org.mule.transformer.AbstractTransformer
        • org.mule.transformer.AbstractMessageTransformer
          • com.deloitte.capi.transformers.TwitterConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.mule.api.AnnotatedObject, org.mule.api.context.MuleContextAware, org.mule.api.lifecycle.Disposable, org.mule.api.lifecycle.Initialisable, org.mule.api.NameableObject, org.mule.api.NamedObject, org.mule.api.processor.MessageProcessor, org.mule.api.transformer.MessageTransformer, org.mule.api.transformer.Transformer, org.mule.endpoint.EndpointAware

    public class TwitterConnector
extends org.mule.transformer.AbstractMessageTransformer

    Java code to connect to the Twitter API, using OAuth security. Implemented as an Anypoint Java Transformer, since it was the easiest way to approach the problem (and the data is returned into the payload, as it would be for a normal transformer, so it is logically consistent.)

    Uses the Twitter4J library, which takes care of the OAuth implementation.

    Author:
    David Hunter (Deloitte)

      • transformMessage

        public java.lang.Object transformMessage(org.mule.api.MuleMessage message,
                                         java.lang.String outputEncoding)
                                  throws org.mule.api.transformer.TransformerException
        Called by Anypoint at runtime. Uses the Twitter4J library to call Twitter, then converts the returned data into Tweet objects.
        Specified by:
        transformMessage in class org.mule.transformer.AbstractMessageTransformer
        Parameters:
        message - The Anypoint message object
        outputEncoding - Not used
        Returns:
        Tweets object, containing all of the tweets that were returned
        Throws:
        org.mule.api.transformer.TransformerException

      • getHashtagsFromStatus

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getHashtagsFromStatus(twitter4j.Status status)
        Helper function that inspects the Status object returned from Twitter, and returns a simpler ArrayList of strings containing those hashtags.
        Parameters:
        status - The Status object returned from Twitter
        Returns:
        Simplfied ArrayList of Strings, for each hashtag in the Status
